result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing entry of 11/19/2015 corrected as follows:

The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.  Huber and Day Reporting Center.  Court stayed commencement until 11/23/2015 by 5pm.

As to Count 2:

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.  Court stayed commencement until 11/23/2016 by 5pm.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 3 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence/count.  Court stayed commencement until 11/23/2016 by 5pm.

Court ordered the defendant provide a DNA sample.

Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA) by 11/19/2016.  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable.  Failure to pay will result in civil judgement.

Filed:  
Sentencing Referral Form

Defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Randy P. Sitzberger for Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for sentencing, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to Counts 1 & 2:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Nick Cerwin for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 09/08/2015 is vacated and converted to a projected guilty plea date in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however defense requests more time.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant is entering into treatment on the orders of the agent on his Federal case. Court grants defense request to adjourn the trial. Case calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 8/13/2015 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 9/8/2015 at 9:00 am.  Parties advised effective August 1, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22, Room 608 of the Courthouse.

Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan in court, defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Calendared for FINAL PRETRIAL on 7/1/2015 at 1:30 pm and JURY TRIAL on 7/15/2015 at 9:00 am in Branch 15. Pretrial Scheduling Order signed and filed.

Attorney Thomas J. Flanagan in court, defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello not in court, in custody.  David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin./ SAB
Defendant's appearance is waived for todays proceedings. Defendant is in Federal custody at Dodge. Case calendared for STATUS on 5/14/2015 at 8:30 am in Branch 15.

Defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Brandon Wigley for David John Behm appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 15.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court orders the signature bond that was signed at the county jail to remain.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and Absolute Sobriety.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Joseph Salvatore Crivello in court with attorney Thomas J. Flanagan.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Defense enters a NOT GUILTY as to COUNT 2. Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.
